intro: Myobroma densa, commonly known as the dense myobroma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
